data.title: Report: Korver joining Nets as development coach
data.meta_description: Trending News & Rumors for Football, Basketball, Baseball, Hockey, Soccer & More
data.text:
Former NBA All-Star Kyle Korver is joining Steve Nash's Brooklyn Nets staff as a player development coach, sources told The Athletic's Shams Charania.

Korver hasn't officially retired from playing, though he didn't appear in an NBA game during the 2020-21 season. He most recently played with the Milwaukee Bucks in 2019-20, serving as a deep-rotation floor-spacer and veteran voice in the locker room.

The 40-year-old sharpshooter has averaged 9.7 points and three rebounds across 17 NBA seasons. He notably shot 42.87% from 3-point territory for his career to sit 10th on the all-time leaderboard and 0.9 percentage points ahead of Nash (42.78%). He led the league in long-range accuracy in four separate seasons.

Korver made his lone All-Star appearance in 2015 while with the Atlanta Hawks.
